gurmukhi: iqn bnbwsI rGubr jwnY ]duK suK sm kr suK duK mwnY ]
transliteration: Tin Banbaasiraghoubar Jaanai|| Doukh Soukh Sam Kar Soukh Doukh Maanai||
translation: “The people residing in the forest, know Raghuvir Ram and consider his suffering and comfort as their own.

gurmukhi: blkl Dr kr Ab bn jYhYN ]rGupq sMg hm bn Pl KYhYN ]277]
transliteration: Balkal Dhar Kar Ab Ban Jaihain|| Raghhoupat San Ham Ban Phal Khaihain||277||
translation: “Now I shall wear the rind of the tree and go to the forest and shall eat the forest fruit with ram.”277.

gurmukhi: iem khw bcnw Gr br Cory ]blkl Dr qn BUKn qory ]
transliteration: Im Kahaa Bachnaa Ghar Bar Chore|| Balkal Dhar Tan Bhookhan Tore||
translation: Saying this Bharat left his home and breaking the ornaments he threw them away and wore the bark-peel.

gurmukhi: AviDs jwry AvDih CwfXo ]rGupiq pg qr kr Gr mwfXo ]
transliteration: Avdhis Jdare Avdhah(i) Chhaadyo|| Raghoupat(i) Pag Tar Kar Ghar Maandyo||278||
translation: He performed the death ceremony of king Dasrath and left Oudh and concentrated on abiding at the feet of Ram.278.

gurmukhi: lK jl Ql kh qj kul Dwey ]mnu mn sMig lY iqh TwN Awey ]
transliteration: Lakh Jal Thal Kah Taj Kul Dhaae|| Man(u) Man San(i) Lai Tih Thaan Aae||
translation: The forest-dwellers, seeing the strong army of Bharat, came alongwith the sages and reached the place where Ram was staying.

gurmukhi: lK bl rwmM Kl dl BIrM ]gih Dn pwxM isq Dr qIrM ]279]
transliteration: Lakh Bal Raamannd Khal Dal Bhderan|| Gad(i) Dhan Paanan Seet Dhar Tderan||279||
translation: Seeing the strong force ram thought that some tyrants had come to attack, therefore he held the bow and arrows in his hands.279.

gurmukhi: gih Dnu rwmM sr br pUrM ]Arbr Qhry Kl hl sUrM ]
transliteration: Gad(i) Dhan(u) Raamannd Sar Bar Pooran|| Arbar Thahre Khal Hal Sooran||
translation: Ram taking his bow in his hand began to discharge arrow and seeing this Indra, sun etc. trembled with fear.

gurmukhi: nr br hrKy Gr Gr AmrM ]Amrir Drky lh kr smrM ]280]
transliteration: Nar Bar Harkhe Ghar Ghar Amaran|| Amrar(i) Dharke Lah Kar Samaran||280||
translation: Seeing this the forest-dwellers felt pleased in their dwelling places, but the gods of Amarpura seeing this battle became anxious.280.

gurmukhi: qb icq Apny BrQr jwnI ]rn rMg rwqy rGubr mwnI ]
transliteration: Tab Chit Apne Bharthar Jaanee|| Ran Ran Raate Raghoubar Maanee||
translation: Then Bharat reflected in his mind that ram was thinking of starting the battle,

gurmukhi: dl bl qij kir iekly insry ]rGubr inrKy sB duK ibsry ]281]
transliteration: Dal Bal Taj(i) Kar(i) Ikle Nisre|| Raghoubar Nirkhe Sabh Doukh Bisre||281||
translation: Therefore he left all his forces, went forward alone and seeing Ram all his sufferings ended.281.

gurmukhi: diRg jb inrKy Bt mx rwmM ]isr Dr tykXM qj kr kwmM ]
transliteration: Drig Jab Nirkhe Bhat Man Raamannd|| Sir Dhar Tekho Taj Kar Kaamannd||
translation: When Bharat saw with his own eyes the mighty Ram, then abandoning all his desires, Bharat prostrated before him.

gurmukhi: iem giq liK kr rGupiq jwnI ]BrQr Awey qj rjDwnI ]282]
transliteration: Im Gad(i) Lakh(i) Kar Raghoupat(i) Jaanee|| Bharthar Aae Taj Rajdhaanee||282||
translation: Seeing this, Ram realized that it was Bharat who had come leaving his capital.282.

gurmukhi: irphw inrKy BrQr jwny ]AviDs mUJy iqn mwn mwny ]
transliteration: Rip-haa Nirkhe Bharthar Jaane|| Avdhis Moond Tin Maan Maane||
translation: Seeing Shatrughan and Bharat, Ram recognized them and it came into the mind of ram and Lakshman that king Dasrath had left this world;
